events.comment: Creates all the external layouts and objects needed for the start of the scene.
Making the hover sprites not blink when the scene starts
Sets the position of objects every frame

If interactable is 1, and the cursor clicks on the button, it changes the selected tab to a value. These values are used later because if we used the actions from those variables here then they will execute whenever the button is pressed, but since they're in the variable which is just being set from the button press, it will only do the actions once until it's changed from another tab press.

Clicking a week button changes the variable "chosenLevel" to a value, which is then used in the Briefing scene and Main scene to set the map, and the external layout which is used for the actual level. This is so we don't need loads of global objects and events, the levels just inherit the objects from the Main scene.
Each tab's variable actions is set here, consisting of tweens, creation and deletion of objects, etc.

Includes the events from the certain days only when the chosenLevel variable is a certain value. Since the creation of the external layout is in the external event, the layouts will ever overlap each other.

[b]Credits:[/b]
Programming:
Astronaronic

Graphics:
Astronaronic
Kenney (kenney.nl)

Font:
Copyright  2020, Braille Institute of America, Inc., https://www.brailleinstitute.org/freefont with
Reserved Typeface Name Atkinson Hyperlegible Font.
For font EULA, see fonts folder in source files.

Thanks:
Silver-Streak
Greench

events.comment: Make the anxiety number count up instead of jumping
Creates the external layout.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
When the checkbox is checked, the condition `Checked` is verified.
A halo appears when the mouse hovers near the checkbox.

Checkbox cannot be toggled by users if any of these are true:
- Checkbox is hidden
- Checkbox's layer is hidden
- Checkbox is disabled

Checkbox can always be changed by an action.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Checkbox
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Checkbox that can be toggled by a left-click or touch.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Checkbox can be toggled by a left-click or touch. 

When the checkbox is checked, the condition `Checked` is TRUE.
A halo appears when the mouse hovers near the checkbox.

Checkbox cannot be toggled by users if any of these are true:
- Checkbox is hidden
- Checkbox's layer is hidden
- Checkbox is disabled

Checkbox can always be changed by an action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Checkbox

events.comment: Fix inputs that create malformed checkboxes
Change shape painter based on properties
Draw checkbox
Set halo radius, if not specified
Detect hover
Change shape painter for halo
Detect touch/click
Draw halo
Draw left-side of checkmark
Draw right-side of checkmark

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Add this behavior to a shape painter object.

When the toggle switch is in the *left* position, the condition `Checked` is "false". If it is in the *right* position, the condition `Checked` is true.
A halo appears when the mouse hovers near the toggle switch.

Toggle switch cannot be toggled by users if any of these are true:
- Toggle switch is hidden
- Toggle switch's layer is hidden
- Toggle switch is disabled

Toggle switch can always be changed by an action.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ToggleSwitch
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Toggle switch that users can click or touch.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Use a shape-painter object to draw a toggle switch that users can click or touch.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ToggleSwitch

Draw half circle at end (optional)
Draw inactive track
Set active track parameters (by default, use thumb color)
Draw half circle at end (optional)
Draw active track
Detect hover/touch/click (but only if the layer and object is visible, and the object is not already being dragged)
Draw halo when the mouse is hovering over thumb
Detect mouse clicks near track, start dragging
Use darker halo while being pressed
Reset scene variable
Drop Shadow
Prepare thumb settings
Draw Circle thumb
Make sure object gets re-drawn every frame

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
The `Value` expression will return the position of the slider on the bar, from 0 to 1, where 0 is the left-side, and 1 is the right-side.

You can [watch this tutorial](https://youtu.be/iiTUwdAT_hs) showing how to use this extension - remember to attach it to a **Shape Painter** object.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggableSliderControl
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use a shape-painter object to draw a horizontal slider that can be dragged by the users.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Use a shape-painter object to draw a horizontal slider that can be dragged by the users. 

The `Value` expression will return the position of the slider on the bar, from 0 to 1, where 0 is the left-side, and 1 is the right-side.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggableSliderControl

Draw active track (2 pixels bigger than property)
Prepare thumb settings
Draw Circle thumb
Draw Rectangle thumb
Make sure thumb width is not smaller than track height (to prevent track ends from showing)
Detect hover/touch/click (but only if the layer and object is visible, and the object is not already being dragged)
Detect mouse clicks near track, start dragging
Draw halo when the mouse is hovering over thumb

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: PANDAKO-GitHub
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Add this behavior to a rectangular sprite object.
That sprite object is the extent to which the user can work with the list.

This behavior requires four other objects.
- Sprite object for background
- Sprite object for icon
- Text object for title
- Text object for text

An item is created with the four objects.
You can create a list with multiple items arranged vertically.

The object variable "ListItems" is created in the sprite object to which this behavior is added.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SimpleScrollableListExtension

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: You can create a list with multiple items arranged vertically.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SimpleScrollableListBehavior

eventsFunctions.description: Create a list from the object variable "ListItems".
eventsFunctions.name: CreateList
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create a list of _PARAM0_ with _PARAM2_, _PARAM3_, _PARAM4_ and _PARAM5_ and scroll to _PARAM6_

events.comment: This doesn't work.

parameters.description: Scroll position of the first line (Number of pixels from the origin of this object)
parameters.name: ScrollPosition

eventsFunctions.description:
Create a list from Json Text.
Example:
{
"0":{"Icon":"A", "Title":"AAA", "Text":"aaa"},
"1":{"Icon":"B", "Title":"BBB", "Text":"bbb"},
...
}
eventsFunctions.name: CreateListFromJsonText
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create a list of _PARAM0_ from _PARAM7_ with _PARAM2_, _PARAM3_, _PARAM4_ and _PARAM5_ and scroll to _PARAM6_

parameters.name: ScrollPosition

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, @arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.

For the behavior, find the list of cursors here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CursorType
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the type of the cursor.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Change the type of the cursor
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeCursorType

events.comment:
Set as variable instead of directly setting as a CursorHover behavior can override it.
By using a variable, we ensure to be able to change it back to that "default" after the override is over.
Reset ordering as the object with highest Z-Order might not exist anymore or be not be hovered anymore.
Set default value of the default cursor if the variable has just been created

events.inlineCode:
// Reset to default cursor
runtimeScene.getGame().getRenderer().getCanvas().style.cursor =
    runtimeScene
        .getGame()
        .getVariables()
        .get("__CursorType_defaultCursor")
        .getAsString();

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Change the cursor appearence when the object is hovered (on Windows, macOS or Linux).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: CursorHover

events.comment: Check the z Order to ensure the cursor shown is the one from the foremost object

events.inlineCode:
// Set cursor to behavior property cursor_type
runtimeScene
    .getGame()
    .getRenderer()
    .getCanvas()
    .style
    .cursor = objects[0]
        .getBehavior(
            eventsFunctionContext.getBehaviorName("Behavior")
        )
        ._getcursor_type();

propertyDescriptors.label: The cursor type
propertyDescriptors.description: See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor for a list of possible cursors.
propertyDescriptors.name: cursor_type

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, axis force, trigger pressure, deadzone for each gamepad, etc...

Up to 4 gamepads can be connected: for each condition or expression, you'll have to enter the index of the gamepad to read. This is 1, 2,3 or 4.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Gamepads
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, trigger pressure, etc...

eventsFunctions.description: Get the value of the pressure on a gamepad trigger.
eventsFunctions.name: TriggerPressure

eventsFunctions.description:
Get the force value of a gamepad stick.
0 is stick on default position, 1 is at the maximum.
eventsFunctions.name: StickForce

eventsFunctions.description:
Get the rotation value of a gamepad stick.
If the deadzone value is high, the angle value is rounded to main axes, left, left, up, down.
An zero deadzone value give a total freedom on the angle value.
eventsFunctions.name: StickRotationValue

eventsFunctions.description: Get the value of axis of a gamepad stick.
eventsFunctions.name: AxisValue

eventsFunctions.description:
Test if a button is released on a gamepad. Buttons can be:
* Xbox: "A", "B", "X", "Y", "LB", "RB", "LT", "RT", "BACK", "START",
* PS4: "CROSS", "SQUARE", "CIRCLE", "TRIANGLE", "L1", "L2", "R1", "R2", "SHARE", "OPTIONS", "PS_BUTTON", "CLICK_TOUCHPAD",
* Other: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "CLICK_STICK_LEFT", "CLICK_STICK_RIGHT"
eventsFunctions.name: C_Button_released

eventsFunctions.description: Return the index of the last pressed button of a gamepad
eventsFunctions.name: LastButtonID

eventsFunctions.description: Check if any button is pressed on a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: C_Any_Button_pressed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Any button of gamepad _PARAM1_ is pressed

eventsFunctions.description:
Return the last button pressed. 
Buttons for Xbox and PS4 can be:
* Xbox: "A", "B", "X", "Y", "LB", "RB", "LT", "RT", "BACK", "START",
* PS4: "CROSS", "SQUARE", "CIRCLE", "TRIANGLE", "L1", "L2", "R1", "R2", "SHARE", "OPTIONS", "PS_BUTTON", "CLICK_TOUCHPAD",
* Both: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "CLICK_STICK_LEFT", "CLICK_STICK_RIGHT"
eventsFunctions.name: LastButtonString

parameters.description: Controller type "XBOX" or "PS4". This defines the type of button names to return as a string. "Mapping not exist" is returned if invalid type is used.
parameters.name: controller_type

eventsFunctions.description:
Check if a button is pressed on a gamepad. 
Buttons can be:
* Xbox: "A", "B", "X", "Y", "LB", "RB", "LT", "RT", "BACK", "START",
* PS4: "CROSS", "SQUARE", "CIRCLE", "TRIANGLE", "L1", "L2", "R1", "R2", "SHARE", "OPTIONS", "PS_BUTTON", "CLICK_TOUCHPAD",
* Other: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "CLICK_STICK_LEFT", "CLICK_STICK_RIGHT"
eventsFunctions.name: C_Button_pressed

eventsFunctions.description: Return the value of the deadzone applied to a gamepad sticks, between 0 and 1.
eventsFunctions.name: Deadzone

eventsFunctions.description: Set the deadzone for sticks of the gamepad. The deadzone is an area for which movement on sticks won't be taken into account (instead, the stick will be considered as not moved). Deadzone is between 0 and 1, and is by default 0.2.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Set_deadzone
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set deadzone for sticks on gamepad: _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

parameters.description: Deadzone for sticks, 0.2 by default (0 to 1)
parameters.name: deadzone

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a stick of a gamepad is pushed in a given direction.
eventsFunctions.name: C_Axis_pushed
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM2_ stick of gamepad _PARAM1_ is pushed in direction _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the number of connected gamepads
eventsFunctions.name: ConnectedGamepadsCount

eventsFunctions.description: Return a string containing informations about the specified gamepad
eventsFunctions.name: GamepadType

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified gamepad has the specified information in its description. Useful to know if the gamepad is a Xbox or PS4 controller.

eventsFunctions.name: C_Controller_X_is_connected

parameters.description: Time of the vibration, in seconds (optional, default value is 1)
parameters.name: duration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if any button is released on a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: C_any_button_released
eventsFunctions.sentence: Any button of gamepad _PARAM1_ is released

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @ddabrahim
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: An action to move the camera by **dragging** with the mouse (or **scrolling** with the touch), on vertical, horizontal or both directions.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: An action to move the camera by dragging with the mouse (or scrolling with the touch), on vertical, horizontal or both directions.

eventsFunctions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctions.sentence: Drag camera _PARAM1_ on layer _PARAM2_ in _PARAM3_ direction with the pointer

events.comment: when mouse button is pressed, get start position of mouse
get direction selected
when mouse button is pressed, get current position of mouse and calculate distance between the previous and current position on X and Y axis
if selected direction is horizontal or both
when mouse button is pressed, move camera on X axis
if direction is vertical or both
when mouse button is pressed, move camera on Y axis

parameters.description: Direction you want to drag the camera. It can be "vertical" or  "horizontal" or "both"
parameters.name: Direction
